title: Are there Python editors with "run highlighted code" feature, other than Pycharm?
author: t2_4avd2wef
text:
Title says it all. Geany is nearly perfect but I would love to death if I could run selected code via highlighting it. sadly it does not and i couldn't find it in the plug-ins either. 

I have Pycharm (which has this feature) but it's not a good program for a beginner. if anyone knows another program which has this feature LET ME KNOW THANK YOU!

comments.author: Binary101010
comments.body: Visual Studio Code with the official Python plugin can do this just fine.

comments.author: suspicious_gardener
comments.body: Jupyter notebook is perfect for beginners and is basically built around this feature.

comments.author: programmingfriend
comments.body: I recommend looking into Jupyter Notebook and consult [this](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab/issues/4206) reference.

comments.author: Guavifo
comments.body: Spyder is a pretty nice editor that comes with Anaconda. You can highlight a section of code, press F9, and it will only run that section. It also lets you see all of your variables in memory, which is a really nice feature when you're debugging.

comments.author: AsleepThought
comments.body: Copy paste it into the terminal and hit Enter
